38751254.review:
This game is about moving around to avoid obstacles. It starts off with simple obstacles and a slow pace, but as you play new modes are unlocked that get faster and have harder obstacles. The achievements are difficult to get, but at the same time are very satisfying once you finally clear them (Berserk Survivor, Perfect Expert Voyage, etc.). The multiplayer is fun and chaotic, but you can't use multiple players on keyboard, unfortunately. To use 3 or 4 player multiplayer you need controllers of some kind. If you have multiple controllers, try this game with friends; it's a great game for co-op multiplayer.

Overall it was a good game; I still come back to it just to see how well I can do in the endless modes.

34212418.review: A really fun, challenging, rage-inducing game. There have been many times where I died 1 or 2 seconds before the end. However that is what makes this game fun, it's so addicting that you'll go back and keep playing it.

33726929.review: an easy to learn but hard to master gameplay loop with only two mouse buttons to avoid obstacles and sometimes frustrating when you die over and over in the same place but that rewarding feeling when you finally master it is just priceless and totall< worth it. it's hard but fair and it's always 100% your fault when you die. additionally the great soundtrack also keeps you hooked. highly addictive!

32902322.review:
A nice little time killer with super simple gameplay, very similar to Super Hexagon. Basically, It's Super Hexagon on a rail.

Each game could last between 30 seconds to 30 minutes.

Despite the super simple gameplay the difficulty can range from challenging to rage-inducing. 

If you're up to the challenge though or want something to keep you busy atleast, give it a shot!

31675358.review:
Hey everyone and this is my review about the game!

This is an idie game.



[h1]Interface/Menu/Settings[/h1]

There is a volume slidebar available.
There is a sensitivty slidebar available.
Almost any resolution size is available.
You can play fullscreen or windowed mode.

[h1]About the game.[/h1]

Well this is a very simple game. You move around with some blue ball and you are trying to make sure that you will not get hit by anything. You will die instantly if you get hit once. You will move automatic over a line that keeps changing and having different looks. You will have to survive and make it all the way to the end. Everytime you will fill up the ring you will gain a checkpoint.

Very repetitive.
Okay music, i think.
Graphics meh.
Gameplay isn't there.
Different game modes.

[h1]Other things.[/h1]

None.

-------------------

I Give this game a 3/10

29727683.review: Fun little gem. Very VERY difficult. I was unfortunately not able to get multiplayer working because it was detecting a 3rd input device on "player 1" that did not / does not exist. However me and the wife found a single player journy to be easily shared using seperate controllers, and it was quite fun. Will I extract more then an hour or two off the game? Probably not. But it was $5, and I will probably whip it out once every few months when friends stop by.

29254968.review:
Vib Ribbon was an interesting game. You controlled a wire rabbit and walked through a course which was generated based on the music that was playing. Pivvot is a game in a similar mould, though there are more varieties of obstacles and a character that is considerably less designed than Vib Ribbon’s protagonist – in this game, you are little more than a couple of dots with a line connecting you.

This is part of what makes Pivvot so enjoyable. It’s so simple, there are no stunning, high-def graphics to distract you from the game, nor is there a story to get bogged down with. You literally just have to guide a little balloon down a line without hitting any of the obstacles, while listening to some pretty fantastic music. The tendency of developers to make games all singing and dancing of late is not always a positive, as it can stretch the game a little too thin. Fixpoint Productions stayed away from that idea, took a very basic game and made it worth playing.

[url=http://vgalmanac.com/reviews/pivvot/]Read more at the Video Game Almanac[/url]

28745650.review:
[h1]Pivvot is an arcade game, where your objective is to avoid the randomly upcoming obstacles.[/h1]

Why you should buy it:

[olist]
[*] You only need 1 Stick or the 2 arrow buttons
[*] Local Co-op with up to 4 players
[*] Fitting soundtrack
[*] Compare your highscores with friends / the world
[*] Hard-to-get Achievements
[/olist]

Why you maybe shouldn't buy it:

[olist]
[*] If its not on sale 4,99 is definitely a bit much for a game like this. For 1,24 its perfectly fine though.
[/olist]

Conclusion: Just buy it, as long as its in sale.

39598494.review:
[b] What is the Game: [/b]
 Simply put, you control a ball that is a fixed distance from a pivot point, which follows a track. Your primary goal is to dodge obstacles that are either fixed or thrown at you until the end or until you die. This game supports local multiplayer, up to four players, using the keyboard, mouse, and/or controllers. There are 8 gamemodes:
[list]
   [*] [b]Voyage[/b] - Easier; play to the end; fixed obstacles, respawning.
   [*] [b]Expert Voyage[/b] - Harder; play to the end; fixed obstacles, respawning.
   [*] [b]Endless[/b] - Voyager, but play to beat your best time.
   [*] [b]Expert Endless[/b] - Expert Voyager, but play to beat your best time.
   [*] [b]Berserker[/b] - Legit Insane Impossible; beat your best time; fixed obstacles.
   [*] [b]Looper[/b] - Increasingly difficult; beat your best score; obstacles thrown at you.
[/list]

There are Steam Trading Cards and eight achievements associated with the game. The achievements provide a good challenge to obtain.

[b] What I have to say: [/b]
The game is fun and addictive. It can take time to learn patterns to the fixed obstacles. When you finally master the Voyage modes, there are the Endless, Looper, and Berserker gamemodes that should help keep providing a challenge to beat your previous scores, or one from the online leaderboard. In the case that you do get stuck trying to pass a certain obstacle (Likely on Expert Voyage), as of the time of this writing, another Steam user has posted a guide to provide tricks to the different obstacles.
